hashes.description: cryptographic hashes, peHashes, and fuzzy hashes

lief.description: LIEF PE json schema. Almost all records are explained in https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/debug/pe-format.

key.description: key used to encode the header (xor operation)

build_id.description: builder number of the tool (if any)

signature.description: 4-byte signature that identifies the file as a PE format image file (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/debug/pe-format#signature-image-only).

machine.description: The number that identifies the type of target machine.

numberof_sections.description: The number of sections. This indicates the size of the section table, which immediately follows the headers (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/debug/pe-format#signature-image-only).

time_date_stamp.description: The low 32 bits of the number of seconds since 00:00 January 1, 1970 (a C run-time time_t value), that indicates when the file was created (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/debug/pe-format#signature-image-only).

numberof_symbols.description: The number of entries in the symbol table. This data can be used to locate the string table, which immediately follows the symbol table. This value should be zero for an image because COFF debugging information is deprecated (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/debug/pe-format#signature-image-only).

pointerto_symbol_table.description: The file offset of the COFF symbol table, or zero if no COFF symbol table is present. This value should be zero for an image because COFF debugging information is deprecated (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/debug/pe-format#signature-image-only).

sizeof_optional_header.description: The size of the optional header, which is required for executable files but not for object files. This value should be zero for an object file (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/debug/pe-format#signature-image-only).

characteristics.description: The flags that indicate the attributes of the file (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/debug/pe-format#signature-image-only).

optional_header.description: Every image file has an optional header that provides information to the loader. This header is optional in the sense that some files (specifically, object files) do not have it. For image files, this header is required (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/debug/pe-format#optional-header-image-only).

magic.description: The unsigned integer that identifies the state of the image file. The most common number is 0x10B, which identifies it as a normal executable file. 0x107 identifies it as a ROM image, and 0x20B identifies it as a PE32+ executable (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/debug/pe-format#optional-header-standard-fields-image-only).

sizeof_code.description: The size of the code (text) section, or the sum of all code sections if there are multiple sections (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/debug/pe-format#optional-header-standard-fields-image-only).

sizeof_initialized_data.description: The size of the initialized data section, or the sum of all such sections if there are multiple data sections (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/debug/pe-format#optional-header-standard-fields-image-only).

sizeof_uninitialized_data.description: The size of the uninitialized data section (BSS), or the sum of all such sections if there are multiple BSS sections (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/debug/pe-format#optional-header-standard-fields-image-only).

addressof_entrypoint.description: The address of the entry point relative to the image base when the executable file is loaded into memory. For program images, this is the starting address. For device drivers, this is the address of the initialization function. An entry point is optional for DLLs. When no entry point is present, this field must be zero (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/debug/pe-format#optional-header-standard-fields-image-only).

baseof_code.description: The address that is relative to the image base of the beginning-of-code section when it is loaded into memory (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/debug/pe-format#optional-header-standard-fields-image-only).

baseof_data.description: The address that is relative to the image base of the beginning-of-data section when it is loaded into memory (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/debug/pe-format#optional-header-standard-fields-image-only). This field is specific to PE32, which is absent in PE32+.

imagebase.description: The preferred address of the first byte of image when loaded into memory; must be a multiple of 64 K. The default for DLLs is 0x10000000. The default for Windows CE EXEs is 0x00010000. The default for Windows NT, Windows 2000, Windows XP, Windows 95, Windows 98, and Windows Me is 0x00400000.

section_alignment.description: The alignment (in bytes) of sections when they are loaded into memory. It must be greater than or equal to FileAlignment. The default is the page size for the architecture.

file_alignment.description: The alignment factor (in bytes) that is used to align the raw data of sections in the image file. The value should be a power of 2 between 512 and 64 K, inclusive. The default is 512. If the SectionAlignment is less than the architecture's page size, then FileAlignment must match SectionAlignment.

major_operating_system_version.description: The major version number of the required operating system.

minor_operating_system_version.description: The minor version number of the required operating system.

major_image_version.description: The major version number of the image.

minor_image_version.description: The minor version number of the image.

major_subsystem_version.description: The major version number of the subsystem.

minor_subsystem_version.description: The minor version number of the subsystem.

sizeof_image.description: The size (in bytes) of the image, including all headers, as the image is loaded in memory. It must be a multiple of SectionAlignment.

sizeof_headers.description: The combined size of an MS-DOS stub, PE header, and section headers rounded up to a multiple of FileAlignment.

checksum.description: The image file checksum. The algorithm for computing the checksum is incorporated into IMAGHELP.DLL. The following are checked for validation at load time: all drivers, any DLL loaded at boot time, and any DLL that is loaded into a critical Windows process.

subsystem.description: The subsystem that is required to run this image.

sizeof_stack_reserve.description: The size of the stack to reserve. Only SizeOfStackCommit is committed; the rest is made available one page at a time until the reserve size is reached (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/debug/pe-format#optional-header-windows-specific-fields-image-only).

sizeof_stack_commit.description: The size of the stack to commit (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/debug/pe-format#optional-header-windows-specific-fields-image-only).

sizeof_heap_reserve.description: The size of the local heap space to reserve. Only SizeOfHeapCommit is committed; the rest is made available one page at a time until the reserve size is reached (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/debug/pe-format#optional-header-windows-specific-fields-image-only).

sizeof_heap_commit.description: The size of the local heap space to commit (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/debug/pe-format#optional-header-windows-specific-fields-image-only).

numberof_rva_and_size.description: The number of data-directory entries in the remainder of the optional header. Each describes a location and size (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/debug/pe-format#optional-header-windows-specific-fields-image-only).

section.description: The name of section containing this data directory

pointerto_relocation.description: The file pointer to the beginning of relocation entries for the section. This is set to zero for executable images or if there are no relocations (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/debug/pe-format#section-table-section-headers).

pointerto_line_numbers.description: The file pointer to the beginning of line-number entries for the section. This is set to zero if there are no COFF line numbers. This value should be zero for an image because COFF debugging information is deprecated (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/debug/pe-format#section-table-section-headers).

numberof_relocations.description: The number of relocation entries for the section. This is set to zero for executable images (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/debug/pe-format#section-table-section-headers).

numberof_line_numbers.description: The number of line-number entries for the section. This value should be zero for an image because COFF debugging information is deprecated (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/debug/pe-format#section-table-section-headers).

characteristics.description: The flags that describe the characteristics of the section (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/debug/pe-format#section-table-section-headers).

relocations.description: The base relocation table contains entries for all base relocations in the image. See https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/debug/pe-format#the-reloc-section-image-only for more details.

virtual_address.description: The image base plus the page RVA is added to each offset to create the VA where the base relocation must be applied (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/debug/pe-format#the-reloc-section-image-only).

block_size.description: The total number of bytes in the base relocation block, including the Page RVA and Block Size fields and the Type/Offset fields that follow (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/debug/pe-format#the-reloc-section-image-only).

position.description: Stored in the remaining 12 bits of the WORD, an offset from the starting address that was specified in the Page RVA field for the block. This offset specifies where the base relocation is to be applied (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/debug/pe-format#the-reloc-section-image-only).

type.description: Stored in the high 4 bits of the WORD, a value that indicates the type of base relocation to be applied. For more information, see Base Relocation Types (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/debug/pe-format#base-relocation-types).

tls.description: The .tls section provides direct PE and COFF support for static thread local storage (TLS). See https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/debug/pe-format#the-tls-section for more details.

addressof_index.description: The location to receive the TLS index, which the loader assigns. This location is in an ordinary data section, so it can be given a symbolic name that is accessible to the program (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/debug/pe-format#the-tls-directory).

addressof_callbacks.description: The pointer to an array of TLS callback functions. The array is null-terminated, so if no callback function is supported, this field points to 4 bytes set to zero. For information about the prototype for these functions, see TLS Callback Functions (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/debug/pe-format#tls-callback-functions).

sizeof_zero_fill.description: The size in bytes of the template, beyond the initialized data delimited by the Raw Data Start VA and Raw Data End VA fields. The total template size should be the same as the total size of TLS data in the image file. The zero fill is the amount of data that comes after the initialized nonzero data (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/debug/pe-format#the-tls-directory).

characteristics.description: The four bits [23:20] describe alignment info. Possible values are those defined as IMAGE_SCN_ALIGN_*, which are also used to describe alignment of section in object files. The other 28 bits are reserved for future use (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/debug/pe-format#the-tls-directory).

data_directory.description: The type of this data directory

export.description: The export symbol information begins with the export directory table, which describes the remainder of the export symbol information (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/debug/pe-format#export-directory-table).

timestamp.description: The time and date that the export data was created (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/debug/pe-format#export-directory-table).

major_version.description: The major version number. The major and minor version numbers can be set by the user (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/debug/pe-format#export-directory-table).

ordinal_base.description: The starting ordinal number for exports in this image. This field specifies the starting ordinal number for the export address table. It is usually set to 1 (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/debug/pe-format#export-directory-table).

debug.description: Image files contain an optional debug directory that indicates what form of debug information is present and where it is (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/debug/pe-format#debug-directory-image-only).

timestamp.description: The time and date that the debug data was created (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/debug/pe-format#debug-directory-image-only).

major_version.description: The major version number of the debug data format (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/debug/pe-format#debug-directory-image-only).

minor_version.description: The minor version number of the debug data format (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/debug/pe-format#debug-directory-image-only).

type.description: The format of debugging information. This field enables support of multiple debuggers. For more information, see Debug Type (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/debug/pe-format#debug-type).

sizeof_data.description: The size of the debug data (not including the debug directory itself).

addressof_rawdata.description: The address of the debug data when loaded, relative to the image base.

pointerto_rawdata.description: The file pointer to the debug data.

forwarder_chain.description: The index of the first forwarder reference (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/debug/pe-format#import-directory-table).

timedatestamp.description: The stamp that is set to zero until the image is bound. After the image is bound, this field is set to the time/data stamp of the DLL (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/debug/pe-format#import-directory-table).

import_address_table_rva.description: The RVA of the import address table. The contents of this table are identical to the contents of the import lookup table until the image is bound (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/debug/pe-format#import-directory-table).

import_lookup_table_rva.description: The RVA of the import lookup table. This table contains a name or ordinal for each import (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/debug/pe-format#import-directory-table).

name.description: An ASCII string that contains the name of the DLL (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/debug/pe-format#import-directory-table).

resources_manager.description: resources manager is a kind of wrapper over the resource tree. See https://lief.quarkslab.com/doc/latest/tutorials/07_pe_resource.html#resource-manager for more details.

key.description: Signature of the structure: Must be the unicode string VS_VERSION_INFO

fixed_file_info.description: Contains version information for a file. This information is language and code page independent. See https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/verrsrc/ns-verrsrc-vs_fixedfileinfo for more details.

signature.description: Contains the value 0xFEEF04BD. This is used with the szKey member of the VS_VERSIONINFO structure when searching a file for the VS_FIXEDFILEINFO structure (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/verrsrc/ns-verrsrc-vs_fixedfileinfo).

struct_version.description: The binary version number of this structure. The high-order word of this member contains the major version number, and the low-order word contains the minor version number (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/verrsrc/ns-verrsrc-vs_fixedfileinfo).

file_version_MS.description: The most significant 32 bits of the file's binary version number. This member is used with dwFileVersionLS to form a 64-bit value used for numeric comparisons (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/verrsrc/ns-verrsrc-vs_fixedfileinfo).

file_version_LS.description: The least significant 32 bits of the file's binary version number. This member is used with dwFileVersionMS to form a 64-bit value used for numeric comparisons (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/verrsrc/ns-verrsrc-vs_fixedfileinfo).

product_version_MS.description: The most significant 32 bits of the binary version number of the product with which this file was distributed. This member is used with dwProductVersionLS to form a 64-bit value used for numeric comparisons (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/verrsrc/ns-verrsrc-vs_fixedfileinfo).

product_version_LS.description: The least significant 32 bits of the binary version number of the product with which this file was distributed. This member is used with dwProductVersionMS to form a 64-bit value used for numeric comparisons (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/verrsrc/ns-verrsrc-vs_fixedfileinfo).

file_flags_mask.description: Contains a bitmask that specifies the valid bits in dwFileFlags. A bit is valid only if it was defined when the file was created (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/verrsrc/ns-verrsrc-vs_fixedfileinfo).

file_flags.description: Contains a bitmask that specifies the Boolean attributes of the file. This member can include one or more of the following values (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/verrsrc/ns-verrsrc-vs_fixedfileinfo).

file_os.description: The operating system for which this file was designed. This member can be one of the following values (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/verrsrc/ns-verrsrc-vs_fixedfileinfo).

file_type.description: The general type of file. This member can be one of the following values. All other values are reserved (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/verrsrc/ns-verrsrc-vs_fixedfileinfo).

file_subtype.description: The function of the file. The possible values depend on the value of dwFileType. For all values of dwFileType not described in the following list, dwFileSubtype is zero (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/verrsrc/ns-verrsrc-vs_fixedfileinfo).

file_date_MS.description: The most significant 32 bits of the file's 64-bit binary creation date and time stamp (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/verrsrc/ns-verrsrc-vs_fixedfileinfo).

file_date_LS.description: The least significant 32 bits of the file's 64-bit binary creation date and time stamp (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/verrsrc/ns-verrsrc-vs_fixedfileinfo).

string_file_info.description: Represents the organization of data in a file-version resource. See https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/menurc/stringfileinfo for more details.

type.description: The type of data in the version resource. This member is 1 if the version resource contains text data and 0 if the version resource contains binary data (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/menurc/stringfileinfo).

langcode_items.description: It's basically a map of key/value (https://github.com/lief-project/LIEF/blob/406115c8d097da0b61f00b2bb7b2442322ffc5d1/include/LIEF/PE/resources/LangCodeItem.hpp#L34-L39).

type.description: The type of data in the version resource (https://github.com/lief-project/LIEF/blob/406115c8d097da0b61f00b2bb7b2442322ffc5d1/include/LIEF/PE/resources/LangCodeItem.hpp#L50-L53).

key.description: A 8-digit hexadecimal number stored as an Unicode string (https://github.com/lief-project/LIEF/blob/406115c8d097da0b61f00b2bb7b2442322ffc5d1/include/LIEF/PE/resources/LangCodeItem.hpp#L55-L60).

var_file_info.description: This object describes information about languages supported by the application (https://github.com/lief-project/LIEF/blob/406115c8d097da0b61f00b2bb7b2442322ffc5d1/include/LIEF/PE/resources/ResourceVarFileInfo.hpp#L33-L36)

type.description: The type of data in the version resource (https://github.com/lief-project/LIEF/blob/406115c8d097da0b61f00b2bb7b2442322ffc5d1/include/LIEF/PE/resources/ResourceVarFileInfo.hpp#L46-L48)

key.description: Signature of the structure: Must be the unicode string 'VarFileInfo' (https://github.com/lief-project/LIEF/blob/406115c8d097da0b61f00b2bb7b2442322ffc5d1/include/LIEF/PE/resources/ResourceVarFileInfo.hpp#L51-L52)

translations.description: List of languages that the application supports (https://github.com/lief-project/LIEF/blob/406115c8d097da0b61f00b2bb7b2442322ffc5d1/include/LIEF/PE/resources/ResourceVarFileInfo.hpp#L55-L59)

load_configuration.description: load configuration structure. See https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/debug/pe-format#the-load-configuration-structure-image-only for more details.

characteristics.description: Flags that indicate attributes of the file, currently unused (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/debug/pe-format#the-load-configuration-structure-image-only).

timedatestamp.description: Date and time stamp value. The value is represented in the number of seconds that have elapsed since midnight (00:00:00), January 1, 1970, Universal Coordinated Time, according to the system clock. The time stamp can be printed by using the C runtime (CRT) time function (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/debug/pe-format#the-load-configuration-structure-image-only).

global_flags_clear.description: The global loader flags to clear for this process as the loader starts the process (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/debug/pe-format#the-load-configuration-structure-image-only).

global_flags_set.description: The global loader flags to set for this process as the loader starts the process (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/debug/pe-format#the-load-configuration-structure-image-only).

critical_section_default_timeout.description: The default timeout value to use for this process's critical sections that are abandoned (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/debug/pe-format#the-load-configuration-structure-image-only).

decommit_free_block_threshold.description: Memory that must be freed before it is returned to the system, in bytes (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/debug/pe-format#the-load-configuration-structure-image-only).

decommit_total_free_threshold.description: Total amount of free memory, in bytes (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/debug/pe-format#the-load-configuration-structure-image-only).

lock_prefix_table.description: [x86 only] The VA of a list of addresses where the LOCK prefix is used so that they can be replaced with NOP on single processor machines (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/debug/pe-format#the-load-configuration-structure-image-only).

virtual_memory_threshold.description: Maximum virtual memory size, in bytes (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/debug/pe-format#the-load-configuration-structure-image-only).

process_affinity_mask.description: Setting this field to a non-zero value is equivalent to calling SetProcessAffinityMask with this value during process startup (.exe only) (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/debug/pe-format#the-load-configuration-structure-image-only)

process_heap_flags.description: Process heap flags that correspond to the first argument of the HeapCreate function. These flags apply to the process heap that is created during process startup (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/debug/pe-format#the-load-configuration-structure-image-only).

editlist.description: Reserved for use by the system (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/debug/pe-format#the-load-configuration-structure-image-only).

security_cookie.description: A pointer to a cookie that is used by Visual C++ or GS implementation (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/debug/pe-format#the-load-configuration-structure-image-only).

se_handler_table.description: [x86 only] The VA of the sorted table of RVAs of each valid, unique SE handler in the image (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/debug/pe-format#the-load-configuration-structure-image-only).

se_handler_count.description: [x86 only] The count of unique handlers in the table (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/debug/pe-format#the-load-configuration-structure-image-only).

guard_cf_check_function_pointer.description: The VA where Control Flow Guard check-function pointer is stored (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/debug/pe-format#the-load-configuration-structure-image-only).

guard_cf_dispatch_function_pointer.description: The VA where Control Flow Guard dispatch-function pointer is stored (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/debug/pe-format#the-load-configuration-structure-image-only).

guard_cf_function_table.description: The VA of the sorted table of RVAs of each Control Flow Guard function in the image (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/debug/pe-format#the-load-configuration-structure-image-only).

guard_cf_function_count.description: The count of unique RVAs in the above table (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/debug/pe-format#the-load-configuration-structure-image-only).

flags.description: Flags to indicate if CI information available, etc (https://github.com/lief-project/LIEF/blob/406115c8d097da0b61f00b2bb7b2442322ffc5d1/include/LIEF/PE/CodeIntegrity.hpp#L41-L42)

reserved.description: Additional bitmask to be defined later (https://github.com/lief-project/LIEF/blob/406115c8d097da0b61f00b2bb7b2442322ffc5d1/include/LIEF/PE/CodeIntegrity.hpp#L48-L49)

guard_address_taken_iat_entry_table.description: The VA where Control Flow Guard address taken IAT table is stored (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/debug/pe-format#the-load-configuration-structure-image-only).

guard_address_taken_iat_entry_count.description: The count of unique RVAs in the above table (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/debug/pe-format#the-load-configuration-structure-image-only).

guard_long_jump_target_table.description: The VA where Control Flow Guard long jump target table is stored (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/debug/pe-format#the-load-configuration-structure-image-only).

guard_long_jump_target_count.description: The count of unique RVAs in the above table (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/debug/pe-format#the-load-configuration-structure-image-only).

die.description: JSON Schema for DIE json output

manalyze_plugin_packer.description: JSON Schema for Manalyze packer plugin json output
